intro: Busea angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, narrow leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. Busea angustifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
